text: Prof. Kemula among his employees, 1963 Wiktor Kemula (born November 6, 1902 in Izmail – October 17, 1985 in Warsaw) was a famous Polish chemist, electrochemist, and polarographist. He greatly contributed to the development of electroanalytical chemistry, particularly polarography. He developed a hanging mercury drop electrode (HMDE). title: Wiktor Kemula
